page.title: 13TINWALD W.R.I/TINWALD GUILD
page.content: Tinwald W.R.I was formed in 1921. It closed down during the war and reopend in 1945. At present, it has a membership of 42 members of which 12 are committee members.They meet once a month in Tinwald Parish Hall from Oct. until May of each year. The purpose of the W.R.I is for women in the country to meet for a social night which includes a demonstator on various things such as cooking,sewing and floral arts. Tinwald Guild has 22 members and has been running for 47 years.They meet in Tinwald Parish Hall starting at 7.30pm and finishing at 9.30pm.They meet once a month on a Tuesday.At the guild,they listen to speakers,look at slides and have discusions.To join, each member pays Â£1.20 and nothing after that.You are a member for as long as you like.
